data.title: Lawfare Strikes Again: Judges Derail Trump‚Äôs Pick, Force Habba Out of Top Prosecutor Role in NJ
data.description: President Trump's quest to install Alina Habba, his former personal defense lawyer, as U. S. Attorney for the District of New Jersey hit another legal roadblock Monday after an appeals court ruled Habba was unlawfully serving as the state's top federal prosecutor. It's the latest move in a months-long legal chess game in which the courts repeatedly undo the president's effort to place Habba in the important blue state role.
data.creator: RedState
data.content: President Trump's quest to install Alina Habba, his former personal defense lawyer, as U. S. Attorney for the District of New Jersey hit another legal roadblock Monday after an appeals court ruled Habba was unlawfully serving as the state's top federal prosecutor. It's the latest move in a months-long legal chess game in which the courts repeatedly undo the president's effort to place Habba in the important blue state role. In a unanimous vote, a three-judge panel for the U. S. Court of Appeals for the 3rd Circuit, sitting in Philadelphia, said that a lower court ruling was correct in disqualifying Habba from serving in the role. The panel concluded that the Trump administration‚Äôs attempts to keep Habba in the role would "effectively [permit] anyone to fill the U. S. Attorney role indefinitely," with the panel adding that "this should raise a red flag." READ MORE: Breaking: Federal Judge Declares Appointment of Trump's Personal Lawyer As US Attorney Illegal Alina Habba Rejected by Federal Judges for Permanent Role As U. S. Attorney for District of New Jersey Here's "Under the Government's delegation theory, Habba may avoid the gauntlet of presidential appointment and Senate confirmation and serve as the de facto U. S. Attorney indefinitely," the ruling said. This saga all started back in March when Trump appointed Habba to the position on an interim basis, which meant she could serve as Acting U. S. Attorney for the District of New Jersey for 120 days. The president then nominated her for the permanent role in June, but the U. S. Senate failed to act on her nomination; he withdrew her nomination on July 24. On that same day, Attorney General Pam Bondi appointed Habba to the role of a special attorney who could conduct "any kind of legal proceedings . which United States Attorneys are authorized to conduct." That move led to U. S. District Judge Matthew Brann to rule in August that Habba had been acting without legal authority for the previous two months and her actions could be considered void. RedState's streiff did a masterful job of summarizing the legal wrangling over Habba's appointment here; he concluded: Because of Senator Thune's inability or unwillingness to break the logjam holding up nominations, several interim U. S. Attorneys are facing a vote by a group of judges. Most of those are going for the administration, but there are a couple that seem doomed to follow Habba's rejection. To streiff's point, Alina Habba isn't the only Trump appointee to find their job enmeshed in a legal quagmire. Lindsay Halligan, Trump's pick for U. S. Attorney for the Eastern District of Virginia, had her appointment ruled "defective" last month. And Bill Essayli, chosen by the president to be Acting U. S. Attorney for the Central District of California, was disqualified after a federal judge ruled in October that Essayli was unlawfully serving in the role because his nomination had failed to be considered by the U. S. Senate. As for Monday's ruling against Alina Habba, the panel had a message for the Trump administration: ‚ÄúIt is apparent that the current administration has been frustrated by some of the legal and political barriers to getting its appointees in place,‚Äù senior US Circuit Judge D. Michael Fisher wrote in the 32-page ruling. ‚ÄúIts efforts to elevate its preferred candidate for US Attorney for the District of New Jersey, Alina Habba, to the role of Acting US Attorney demonstrate the difficulties it has faced-yet the citizens of New Jersey and the loyal employees in the US Attorney‚Äôs Office deserve some clarity and stability.‚Äù As of this writing, the Trump White House had not commented on the ruling. Next steps could be for the administration to ask a full panel of 3rd Circuit judges to reconsider the decision or going right to the U. S. Supreme Court. Editor's Note: Radical leftist judges are doing everything they can to hamstring President Trump's agenda to make America great again.

data.title: ‚ÄûBeeilt euch‚Äú ‚Äì Tusk setzt Merz bei Entsch√§digung f√ºr NS-Opfer unter Druck
data.description: Die russische Bedrohung hat Deutschland und Polen enger zusammenr√ºcken lassen. Es bleibt aber ein Problem aus der Vergangenheit, bei dem ein Einvernehmen weiter nicht in Sicht ist.
data.creator: WELT
data.content: Anzeige Beide L√§nder setzen sich f√ºr einen Frieden in der Ukraine ein. Doch bei der Frage nach Deutschlands Verantwortung 86 Jahre nach Beginn des Zweiten Weltkrieg gehen die Meinungen weit auseinander, wie sich einmal mehr in Berlin zeigt. Polen dr√§ngt Deutschland zu einer schnellen Entsch√§digung der noch lebenden Opfer der deutschen Besatzung im Zweiten Weltkrieg. ‚ÄûBeeilt euch, wenn ihr wirklich diese Geste machen wollt‚Äú, sagte Polens Ministerpr√§sident Donald Tusk nach den deutsch-polnischen Regierungskonsultationen in Berlin bei einer Pressekonferenz mit Bundeskanzler Friedrich Merz (CDU). Der polnische Regierungschef verwies darauf, dass die Zahl der noch lebenden Opfer des Nazi-Terrors in seinem Land st√§ndig zur√ºckgehe. Als der damalige Kanzler Olaf Scholz im Juli 2024 diese Unterst√ºtzung versprochen habe, h√§tte es nach Angaben der Stiftung f√ºr deutsch-polnische Auss√∂hnung noch 60. 000 lebende Opfer gegeben, mittlerweile seien es noch 50. 000. Rechnet man das um, sind seitdem pro Tag mehr als 20 Opfer gestorben. Anzeige Lesen Sie auch Scholz hatte die individuelle Geste an die Opfer bei den letzten Regierungskonsultationen versprochen. Ein konkreter Vorschlag wurde daraus aber nicht. Merz bekannte sich auf der gemeinsamen Pressekonferenz mit Tusk zwar zur deutschen Verantwortung f√ºr das die von Nazi-Deutschland angerichtete Leid und Zerst√∂rung in Polen. ‚ÄûDie Vergangenheit h√∂rt nie auf‚Äú, sagte er. ‚ÄûErinnerung und Aufarbeitung werden f√ºr uns niemals abgeschlossen sein. Deutschland steht zu seiner historischen Verantwortung.‚Äú Der Kanzler bekr√§ftigte aber auch die seit Jahrzehnten geltende deutsche Haltung, dass die Reparationsfrage abgeschlossen sei. ‚ÄûDie Frage nach Reparationen ist aus deutscher Sicht juristisch und politisch seit vielen Jahren abschlie√üend beantwortet.‚Äú Anzeige Kriegsvergangenheit Dauerthema in Beziehungen Der deutsche √úberfall auf Polen am 1. September 1939 war der Beginn des Zweiten Weltkriegs mit insgesamt mindestens 55 Millionen Toten andere Sch√§tzungen kommen sogar auf bis zu 80 Millionen. Genaue Zahlen gibt es nicht. Polen blieb √ºber mehrere Jahre von den Deutschen besetzt und hatte gemessen an der Gesamtbev√∂lkerung so viele Tote zu beklagen wie kein anderes Land. Der Umgang mit den dramatischen Folgen der deutschen Besatzung Polens im Zweiten Weltkrieg ist ein Dauerthema in den Beziehungen beider L√§nder. Weiterhin stehen polnischen Reparationsforderungen in Billionenh√∂he f√ºr die damals angerichteten Sch√§den im Raum, die zuletzt im September von Polens Pr√§sidenten Karol Nawrocki bei seinem Antrittsbesuch in Berlin erhoben und von Merz und Bundespr√§sident Frank-Walter Steinmeier zur√ºckgewiesen wurden. Lesen Sie auch Anders als der rechtskonservative Pr√§sident Polens thematisiert die Mitte-Links-Regierung von Ministerpr√§sident Tusk die Reparationsfrage nicht mehr offensiv sie erwartet von der Bundesregierung aber zun√§chst einmal mindestens diese Geste der Unterst√ºtzung f√ºr die noch lebenden Opfer. Das Projekt einer festen Gedenkst√§tte f√ºr die polnischen Kriegsopfer in Berlin wollen beide Seiten aber vorantreiben. Daf√ºr sollen konkrete Ausschreibungsverfahren gestartet werden. Vertiefte Zusammenarbeit im Verteidigungsbereich Im Zentrum der Konsultationen stand eigentlich die Vertiefung der Beziehungen in den Bereichen Verteidigung, Wirtschaft und Infrastruktur. Tusk wertete die Ergebnisse des Treffens als ‚Äûeine historische Ver√§nderung‚Äú. Er w√ºrdigte vor allem die ‚Äûumfassende polnisch-deutsche Zusammenarbeit in Bezug auf die Verteidigung der Ostgrenze Europas bezeichnen‚Äú. Dazu soll zum 35. Jubil√§um des deutsch-polnischen Nachbarschaftsvertrags im n√§chsten Jahr ein Abkommen mit konkreten Projekten unterzeichnet werden. Lesen Sie auch Merz nannte Deutschland und Polen ‚Äûunverzichtbare Nachbarn und Partner‚Äú. Bei der Modernisierung der Infrastruktur geht es unter anderem um die Bahnlinie zwischen dem brandenburgischen Angerm√ºnde und der polnischen Grenzstadt Stettin sowie um die Stra√üenverbindung an der Grenze bei Frankfurt an der Oder. Wie l√§uft es in der Ukraine-Politik? Merz beschwor auch die Einigkeit europ√§ischer Partner bei den Ukraine-Verhandlungen. Beide kamen aus einem Telefonat mit dem ukrainischen Pr√§sidenten Wolodymyr Selenskyj, dem franz√∂sischen Staatschef Emmanuel Macron, dem britischen Regierungschef Keir Starmer und anderen europ√§ischen Partnern. Zu dem strategischen Ziele geh√∂re es, alles in der Macht Stehende zu tun, um Kiew gegen√ºber dem russischen Aggressor beizustehen. ‚ÄûWir wollen dabei nun den st√§rksten Hebel nutzen, der uns zur Verf√ºgung steht, um Moskau endlich an den Verhandlungstisch zu bringen. Zusammen wollen wir in Br√ºssel durchsetzen, dass wir die eingefrorenen russischen Verm√∂genswerte nutzen‚Äú, sagte Merz. Lesen Sie auch Anfang Mai war Merz zusammen mit Tusk, Macron und Starmer in Kiew, um die Solidarit√§t mit der Ukraine zu demonstrieren. Den aktuellen Verhandlungsprozess √ºber einen Friedensplan f√ºhren nun aber Deutschland, Frankreich und Gro√übritannien ohne Polen, das lediglich konsultiert wird obwohl Polen als Nachbarland der Ukraine und Russlands besonders von dem Krieg betroffen ist. In Polen hat das zuletzt f√ºr Entt√§uschung gesorgt. ‚ÄûDerzeit sieht es so aus, als w√§ren wir bei den Verhandlungen √ºberfl√ºssig‚Äú, schrieb die ‚ÄûGazeta Wyborcza‚Äú, eines der wichtigsten polnischen Medien, kurz vor den Konsultationen. dpa/saha.

data.title: DSA-linked DC councilmember mounts mayoral bid to succeed Bowser
data.description: Washington D. C. Coucilmember Janeese Lewis George has mounted a mayoral bid following current Mayor Muriel Bowser's announcement that she will not seek another term.
data.creator: Fox News
data.content: NEWYou can now listen to Fox News articles! A D. C. Councilmember with ties to the Democratic Socialists of America (DSA) has announced a bid for mayor of the nation's capital. Councilmember Janeese Lewis George issued a statement on Monday that she is launching a mayoral campaign, aiming to succeed long-serving Mayor Muriel Bowser, who is not pursuing re-election. The progressive Democrat said that "too many residents still feel squeezed financially, from unaffordable housing to childcare, and feel unsafe in their neighborhoods. Residents face uneven access to opportunity and a city government that on its best days feels unresponsive, and on its worst, is leaving residents out in the cold all because leaders have chosen to prioritize the needs of the well-connected over us. "That‚Äôs wrong, it‚Äôs not the DC we should be and that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm running for Mayor," she added. WHERE THE TRUMP ADMIN'S COURT FIGHT OVER NATIONAL GUARD IN DC STANDS IN WAKE OF SHOOTING Bowswer, who has been in office since 2015, announced last month that she will not run for a fourth term. "DC is a place that honors and celebrates its leaders. We will always be grateful for Mayor Bowser‚Äôs devoted public service and impactful leadership," George said in a post responding to Bowser's announcement. The mayoral hopeful first won her seat on the council in a 2020 election, in which she was supported by the DSA. Upon her victory, the organization congratulated her in a press release that referred to her as "our chapter member and endorsed candidate[.]" BOWSER ENDS DECADE-LONG REIGN AS DC MAYOR AFTER 3 TERMS IN OFFICE, WON'T SEEK FOURTH Earlier this year when President Donald Trump moved to leverage the National Guard and D. C. Metropolitan Police Department to crack down on crime in the nation's capital, George was a vocal critic. TRUMP INVITES FAMILIES OF TWO NATIONAL GUARD MEMBERS SHOT IN DC TO WHITE HOUSE, PLANS TO HONOR SOLDIERS.

A primera hora, el president s'ha reunit ja amb els rectors de les universitats catalanes despla√ßades a la FIL, la UB, la UAB i la UPF. Tamb√© en clau catalana, Illa s'ha pogut trobar una estona amb alguns dels escriptors catalans presents a la Fira del Llibre, com Carme Riera, Vict√≤ria Szpunberg i Josep Maria Mir√≥. En l'√†mbit internacional, el president catal√† es reuneix tamb√© amb l'ambaixador de la Uni√≥ Europea a M√®xic, Francisco Andr√©. Finalment, despr√©s d'inaugurar l'estand de Catalunya a la FIL, Illa mantindr√† tamb√© una trobada amb joves artistes catalans.

data.description: El alcalde de M√°laga, Francisco de la Torre, se ha referido este lunes al comienzo, desde este pasado domingo, del segundo a√±o de vigencia de la ordenanza de Movilidad Sostenible y a las nuevas restricciones en la Zona de Bajas Emisiones (ZBE). data.creator: felix
data.content: El alcalde de M√°laga, Francisco de la Torre, se ha referido este lunes al comienzo, desde este pasado domingo, del segundo a√±o de vigencia de la ordenanza de Movilidad Sostenible y a las nuevas restricciones en la Zona de Bajas Emisiones (ZBE). As√≠, ha dicho que espera que ¬´se vea como algo que es positivo para todos¬ª. As√≠ lo ha se√±alado De la Torre, que ha incidido en que ¬´se trata de que apostemos m√°s por el transporte p√∫blico, que usemos menos el coche particular y que vayamos tambi√©n cambiando los coches particulares que, digamos, contaminan a coches que sean m√°s sostenibles desde el punto de vista ambiental¬ª. ¬´Eso nos interesa a todos¬ª, ha apostillado. Al respecto, ha se√±alado que se tiene que ser ¬´de una manera gradual¬ª y ha recordado que ¬´hay ayudas¬ª. ¬´Tenemos que ir en esa direcci√≥n. Y lo hemos hecho de una manera muy suave, muy flexible¬ª en relaci√≥n con las personas que tienen el coche domiciliado en M√°laga. En relaci√≥n con los de ¬´fuera¬ª, De la Torre ha incidido en que ¬´vamos a trabajar intensamente para tener los aparcamientos disuasorios para que puedan ir a dejar el coche y puedan luego coger el transporte p√∫blico¬ª. ¬´Ese es el camino por nuestra parte¬ª, ha dicho, al tiempo que ha agregado que queda ¬´el transporte interurbano mejorarlo¬ª, pero ¬´es un tema que desborda nuestra capacidad tiene que ser desde la propia Junta y desde el Gobierno central los que vayan apoyando y ayudando¬ª. Entre otros, ha recordado que, por ejemplo, el Cercan√≠as del Valle del Guadalahorce ¬´debe tener m√°s frecuencia¬ª. En relaci√≥n con los aparcamientos disuasorios, ha dicho que se har√°n ¬´cuanto antes, iremos avanzando. Son muchos frentes con los cuales trabajamos. Ahora estamos muy absorbidos el tema de la vivienda, porque ese tema tambi√©n estamos trabajando¬ª. ¬´Aparcamientos, tanto en el este, al lado del arroyo Total√°n, como en la zona oeste, la zona de Mart√≠n Carpena, est√°n proyectados y en marcha¬ª, ha abundado el regidor. Veh√≠culo domiciliado De igual modo, ha pedido ¬´paciencia¬ª a los conductores que no tengan el coche domiciliado en M√°laga en relaci√≥n con la Zona de Bajas Emisiones (ZBE). ¬´Pueden entrar, lo que no pueden es hacer el recorrido. Tienen que tener cuidado de rodearlo nada m√°s. Yo dir√≠a que paciencia, conocerlo bien e iremos trabajando todo¬ª, ha sostenido, ya que ¬´es tarea de todos¬ª. Ha agregado que ¬´no pidamos al ayuntamiento en Espa√±a -M√°laga es un ayuntamiento espa√±ol- lo que en Europa s√≠ tienen much√≠simas competencias, tienen m√°s recursos, pero en Espa√±a los ayuntamientos no tenemos recursos para los temas interurbanos, esa es la realidad¬ª. ¬´El transporte interurbano es un tema que est√° a nivel nacional y a nivel auton√≥mico¬ª, ha se√±alado. El segundo a√±o de vigencia de la ordenanza de Movilidad Sostenible de la ciudad de M√°laga comenz√≥ este pasado domingo, 30 de noviembre. Cabe recordar que el Bolet√≠n Oficial de la provincia public√≥ el pasado 29 de noviembre de 2024 el nuevo texto normativo por el cual se regula el acceso y la circulaci√≥n por la Zona de Bajas Emisiones (ZBE). Durante este primer a√±o de vigencia han circulado por la ZBE los veh√≠culos (coches y motos) acreditados por la DGT con etiqueta ambiental ‚ÄòCERO‚Äô, ‚ÄòECO‚Äô o ‚ÄòC‚Äô; los que tienen etiqueta ambiental ‚ÄòB‚Äô; y los que carecen de etiqueta ambiental, han recordado desde el Ayuntamiento de M√°laga en un comunicado. As√≠, desde este pasado domingo comenz√≥ el segundo a√±o y, por tanto, se restringe la circulaci√≥n a los veh√≠culos que no tengan etiqueta medioambiental y que no estuvieran domiciliados en M√°laga antes de la entrada en vigor de la ordenanza de Movilidad Sostenible (30 de noviembre de 2024). Todos los dem√°s tipos (‚ÄòCERO‚Äô, ‚ÄòECO‚Äô, ‚ÄòC‚Äô y ‚ÄòB‚Äô), domiciliados o no en M√°laga, podr√°n seguir circulando.

data.title: TPUSA Scandal Erupts As Female Staffer Accused Of Harassing Male Employee And Kidnapping Daughter
data.description: A new civil lawsuit accuses Avondale City Council member and Turning Point USA (TPUSA) staffer Jeannette Garcia of offering a subordinate a job in exchange for sex.
data.creator: Chelsie Napiza
data.content: A civil lawsuit has ignited a storm around Turning Point USA, alleging that a female staffer propositioned a male colleague for sex, and, when rebuffed, spiralled into what the complaint describes as an alleged kidnapping of his teenage daughter. The case accuses TPUSA staffer and Avondale City Council member Jeannette Garcia of exploiting her professional authority by making explicit sexual propositions to a male employee she supervised, and later removing his 14-year-old daughter from their home under what the plaintiffs describe as 'false pretences' and 'manipulation'. These claims, if proven, could raise profound questions about safeguarding and organisational governance within TPUSA at a moment when political youth groups are under heightened national scrutiny. Sexual Harassment Allegations Erupt The lawsuit, filed on 14 November 2025 under pseudonyms Father John Doe and Minor Jane Doe, claims that the incident occurred during a post-election celebration among staff of TPUSA at a restaurant in Goodyear, Phoenix suburb. According to the court filing, the accused, Garcia, who at the time was also employed by TPUSA, approached the male employee she supervised and made repeated sexual advances. She allegedly offered him employment with TPUSA in exchange for sex. He declined, telling the suit he 'repeatedly rebuffed' her overtures. The plaintiff says that Garcia's behaviour deteriorated sharply after what he described as 'excessive consumption of alcohol'. Confronted by the advances and growing aggressiveness, he departed the event and headed home shortly after midnight. Alleged Kidnapping of Teen Daughter The suit alleges that when the father arrived home roughly 45 minutes later, his 14-year-old daughter was nowhere to be found. According to the complaint, deputies from the county sheriff's office informed the father that his daughter was 'safe' and in the custody of Garcia. The man said the deputies claimed she was with her 'guardian' Garcia, but did not explain how she came to be there. The father reportedly tried contacting both his daughter and Garcia multiple times without success. Finally, at about 02: 20 a. m., Garcia allegedly answered and confirmed she had the girl. The filing claims that Garcia, described as 'extremely intoxicated', along with two other adults, 'manipulated' the teenager into a car by telling her that her father had been drinking and might become violent. The complaint states the daughter was taken without permission or consent and remained in Garcia's care overnight, effectively amounting to false imprisonment. The child was reportedly returned only the next day, after her grandmother called Garcia, from a number the councilwoman did not immediately recognise, and arranged to meet her at a restaurant to pick her up. The lawsuit details emotional and psychological harm. The daughter was allegedly left 'depressed' and 'terrified' to leave her room, with a marked decline in academic performance and extracurricular participation. Legal Claims and Background Filed in the Maricopa County Superior Court, the lawsuit names Garcia, the deputised county officers allegedly involved, and even TPUSA-affiliated employees. The charges include sexual harassment, civil conspiracy, and false imprisonment. To date, no criminal charges have been filed against Garcia. The case remains a civil complaint, and the plaintiffs are seeking damages, though the amount is not publicly disclosed in the filings. The case underscores a troubling intersection between workplace misconduct and alleged abuse of authority for personal gain, in this case, a so-called 'job-for-sex' proposition by a supervisor. Opponents of TPUSA argue the allegations cast a harsh light on the group's internal culture, particularly as the accused held both a political office and an influential role within a national political organisation. Denial and the Wider Reputation Fallout In a statement to local media, Garcia denied all allegations. She called them 'outrageous and false' and said she had 'never kidnapped anyone, never harmed anyone, and never solicited anything inappropriate'. She added that she was considering legal action against those she claims are defaming her. TPUSA, which has previously been the subject of scrutiny for other controversies, has not issued any official statement referring to the lawsuit, nor confirmed whether she remains employed by the organisation. Media reached out to both organisation and the county sheriff's office, but this yielded no response. The case provokes questions about potential complicity by law enforcement. The lawsuit claims the deputies present at the time either failed to act or facilitated the alleged removal of a minor from her home, a serious assertion that could trigger investigations beyond the civil domain.

data.title: Glendale police identify 2 people killed in crash Friday
data.description: Glendale police said Jaslin Avila and Cynthia Garcia Morales were killed in a crash near Bell Road and the Loop 101 Agua Fria Freeway.
data.creator: Jeff Vinton
data.content: PHOENIX Police have identified two people who were killed in a crash in the West Valley on Friday. Jaslin Avila, 21, and Cynthia Garcia Morales, 24, were both killed in the collision, which happened near Bell Road and the Loop 101 Agua Fria Freeway, according to the Glendale Police Department. The victims were cousins, according to a GoFundMe campaign to raise funds for funeral expenses. Police said Avila was driving a white GMC with Morales and three juveniles inside when he collided with a woman driving a silver Hyundai. The three children and the woman driving the silver Hyundai all received non-life-threatening injuries in the crash, police said. The crash led to an extended closure of the Loop 101 off-ramps at Bell Road. The investigation into this crash is still underway.

data.title: Seguir luchando contra la estigmatizaci√≥n y la desinformaci√≥n: ‚ÄúLos cr√≠os nos dicen que es una enfermedad de viejos‚Äù
data.description: En el D√≠a Mundial de respuesta al VIH/sida el Comit√© Antisida de Salamanca evidencia la falta de informaci√≥n y de la percepci√≥n del riesgo en las nuevas generaciones: ‚ÄúSe piensan que por ser heterosexual ya est√°n vacunados‚Äù.
data.creator: Salamanca 24 Horas
data.content: El Comit√© Antisida de Salamanca lleva 40 a√±os saliendo a la calle el 1 de diciembre para concienciar a la sociedad salmantina de la importancia de que no caiga en el olvido que el VIH sigue presente. El g√©lido primer lunes de diciembre no ha sido impedimento para que su carpa haya vuelto a colocarse en la plaza del Liceo. Lo hacen, como cada a√±o, por tres motivos fundamentales. ‚ÄúEl primero es la protecci√≥n, porque es la √∫nica vacuna que existe hoy por hoy. Desde los comienzos y hasta hoy en d√≠a, y lo que nos falte, la √∫nica vacuna que existe es la prevenci√≥n‚Äù, cuenta Carlos Rodrigo, miembro de la Junta Directiva del Comit√©. El segundo motivo es una llamada de atenci√≥n: ‚ÄúCualquier persona que tenga una pr√°ctica de riesgo, lo mejor es hacerse una prueba, puesto que cuanto antes se pueda detectar la infecci√≥n, m√°s f√°cil es que no evolucione el virus‚Äù. Por √∫ltimo, el Comit√© no quiere olvidarse de aquellos que se llev√≥ la enfermedad: ‚ÄúHoy tambi√©n es un d√≠a para hacer un recordatorio de todas las personas que han fallecido por causa del VIH y por ello tambi√©n damos el lazo rojo conmemorativo‚Äù. Como medida de protecci√≥n y concienciaci√≥n, desde la propia carpa situada en la plaza del Liceo hacen entrega de diferentes tipos de objetos de protecci√≥n sexual, as√≠ como panfletos informativos. Una forma de intentar apelar a las nuevas generaciones: ‚ÄúHay que educar en la percepci√≥n del riesgo, porque creemos que la est√° bajando en ellos. Nosotros cuando vamos a colegios o institutos ya nos dicen los cr√≠os y las cr√≠as que esto es una enfermedad de viejos o que a ellos no les va a tocar. Con esto quiero decir que no son conscientes de que cualquier pr√°ctica en la que no utilices un medio de protecci√≥n te puede infectar, pero no solo de VIH, sino de cualquier ETS‚Äù. Para el Comit√© Antisida la enfermedad todav√≠a crea muchos estigmas. ‚ÄúEl primero es el autoestigma. Cualquier persona reci√©n diagnosticada lo primero que te pregunta es, ¬øme voy a morir? Es decir, todav√≠a existe en el subconsciente colectivo de que el VIH es una enfermedad mortal. Y hoy por ah√≠, con los avances terap√©uticos y sanitarios, una persona con un VIH puede vivir la misma cantidad y calidad de vida que una persona sin un VIH‚Äù, reflexiona Carlos Rodrigo en declaraciones a este medio. "Piensan que al ser heterosexuales ya estas vacunado, que no te va a tocar nada‚Äù. A√±ade, adem√°s, que no solo existe el desconocimiento del propio paciente, sino que √©l mismo se crea un estigma por el posible rechazo social: ‚Äúlo primero que hace es call√°rselo para evitar la discriminaci√≥n y lo vive en solitario. El no comentarlo ni a la familia m√°s cercana, ni a los amigos lo hacen como medida de prevenci√≥n, para evitar el rechazo. De ah√≠ viene tambi√©n mucho de lo que hacemos en el Comit√©, que es un movimiento para que la gente sepa que no est√° sola, que pod√©is vivir perfectamente‚Äù. Preguntamos a Carlos si cree que la sociedad sigue pensando que el VIH solo lo contraen hombres homosexuales o drogodependientes: ‚Äúsi lo creen, hoy por hoy es falso. Fue verdad en los or√≠genes con las famosas cuatro haches, es decir, heroin√≥manos, homosexuales, haitianos y hemof√≠licos. Sin embargo, actualmente cualquier relaci√≥n sexual, sea homosexual o heterosexual, puede transmitir el VIH‚Äù. En esa l√≠nea Carlos Rodrigo defiende que existe una falsa creencia y mucha menos percepci√≥n del riesgo en las relaciones heterosexuales: ‚ÄúLos vemos claramente con los datos epidemiol√≥gicos. Las personas que han tenido relaciones sexuales de este tipo y que han sido diagnosticadas recientemente, tienen un retraso en el diagn√≥stico. Es decir, que hace cuatro o cinco a√±os tuvieron el contacto de riesgo y existi√≥ la transmisi√≥n, pero no se hicieron una prueba porque pensaban que al ser heterosexuales ya estabas vacunado, que no te va a tocar nada‚Äù. Por √∫ltimo, piden a la sociedad y a la clase pol√≠tica medidas para una mejor educaci√≥n sexual: ‚ÄúEn este pa√≠s brilla por su ausencia. La mejor manera de frenar no solo infecciones por VIH, sino cualquier otro tipo de ETS, es la educaci√≥n. Esto es algo que llevamos reivindicado desde los or√≠genes y creemos que tiene que haber una buena programaci√≥n en las escuelas, colegios e institutos. Aqu√≠ no vale solo que un d√≠a vaya alguien de Cruz Roja o de nuestro Comit√© a darte una charla‚Äù, finaliza Carlos Rodrigo, representante del Comit√© Antisida de Salamanca.

data.title: Son of ‚ÄòEl Chapo‚Äô is set for a change-of-plea hearing in US drug case
data.description: CHICAGO (AP) A son of notorious Mexican drug kingpin ‚ÄúEl Chapo‚Äù was set Monday to change his not guilty plea in a U. S. drug trafficking case, months after his brother entered a plea deal. Joaquin Guzman Lopez had been scheduled to be in court Monday in Chicago for a status hearing, but a court.
data.creator: AP News
data.content: CHICAGO (AP) A son of notorious Mexican drug kingpin ‚ÄúEl Chapo‚Äù was set Monday to change his not guilty plea in a U. S. drug trafficking case, months after his brother entered a plea deal. Joaquin Guzman Lopez had been scheduled to be in court Monday in Chicago for a status hearing, but a court document said the appearance would now be a change-of-plea hearing. The document didn‚Äôt say whether he would be pleading guilty, and Jeffrey Lichtman, Joaquin Guzman Lopez‚Äôs attorney, did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Known locally as the ‚ÄúChapitos,‚Äù or ‚Äúlittle Chapos,‚Äù Joaquin Guzman Lopez and his brother, Ovidio Guzman Lopez, are accused of running a faction of the Sinaloa cartel. Federal authorities in 2023 described the operation as a massive effort to send ‚Äústaggering‚Äù quantities of fentanyl into the U. S. Joaquin Guzman Lopez and another longtime Sinaloa leader, Ismael ‚ÄúEl Mayo‚Äù Zambada, were arrested in July 2024 in Texas after they landed in the U. S. on a private plane. Both men have previously pleaded not guilty to various drug trafficking, money laundering and firearms charges. Their dramatic capture prompted a surge in violence in Mexico‚Äôs northern state of Sinaloa as two factions of the Sinaloa cartel clashed. Ovidio Guzman Lopez was the first son of drug lord Joaquin ‚ÄúEl Chapo‚Äù Guzman to enter a plea deal, for which he admitted to helping oversee the production and smuggling of large quantities of cocaine, heroin, methamphetamine, marijuana and fentanyl into the United States, fueling a crisis that has contributed to tens of thousands of overdose deaths annually. Ovidio Guzman Lopez pleaded guilty to drug trafficking, money laundering and firearms charges tied to his leadership role in the cartel. Legal experts called the plea deal a significant step for the U. S. government in their investigation and prosecution of Sinaloa cartel leaders. Joaquin ‚ÄúEl Chapo‚Äù Guzman is serving a life sentence after being convicted in 2019 for his role as the former leader of the Sinaloa cartel, having smuggled mountains of cocaine and other drugs into the United States over 25 years. The brothers allegedly assumed their father‚Äôs former role as leaders of the cartel.

data.content: Didn‚Äôt get a chance to grab a solid tablet during Black Friday? Don‚Äôt worry. Cyber Monday is here, slashing prices across all popular categories, and offering one last chance to save massively before the holiday season begins. We‚Äôve been spotting tons of great options going for less, and if you‚Äôre after something that covers all the basics while staying under the $100 mark, the Lenovo Tab One is an excellent option to consider. It‚Äôs now sitting at just $90, after a nice 25% discount, and there are no delivery charges to worry about either. It‚Äôs not every day you get to grab an impressive screen while also saving on shipping, so get your orders in sooner rather than later. The tablet is going to be pushed back to its retail price of $120 at midnight, which is why it‚Äôs best to act fast. See at Amazon Bright Visuals, Even Better Sound We won‚Äôt label it as a massive tablet. You‚Äôre getting a modest 8. 7-inch display, which isn‚Äôt overwhelmingly large; just enough for a comfortable viewing experience on the go. The display pushes vibrant visuals, while the 480 nits of brightness ensure exceptional visibility in all lighting conditions. Of course, visuals alone aren‚Äôt enough for an immersive streaming experience, which is why Lenovo packs the tablet with dual Dolby Atmos speakers for bold, rich audio. Translation? Brighter content, paired with an even better sound that brings your favorite content to life. Performance is taken care of by the MediaTek Helio G85 processor, plus a 60Hz refresh rate, both of which come together to ensure a smooth, lag-free experience. You won‚Äôt exactly be able to multitask on this tablet, but it holds up well for casual use like browsing, streaming, video calls, etc. In fact, it‚Äôs a great option for kids, too. Google Kids Space support lets you introduce your little ones to teacher-approved content based on their interests. . Storing all the media content and programs you want won‚Äôt be an issue, thanks to the massive 64GB of storage, which is quite rare to find in this price range. If you‚Äôre purchasing it for your kids, you can pre-install a bunch of kid-friendly apps and games to keep them entertained for hours. There‚Äôs an included folio case to protect your tablet from the inevitable daily wear and tear. The built-in stand lets you prop it up wherever you like, however you prefer it. Place it on your workstation, a cafe, or even your bed for some late-night streaming sessions. As for the battery, a single charge gets you around 12. 5 hours of unplugged YouTube streaming. It‚Äôs also designed to recharge faster than previous models, so it should be back at it in no time when running low. And since the tablet is compact, you don‚Äôt have to get a dedicated bag to carry it. Just toss it in your purse or backpack, and you‚Äôre good to go. To wrap it up, this tablet isn‚Äôt a powerhouse. It‚Äôs made to do all the basic tasks, and it does those well. We especially recommend it for kids/teenagers wanting to have their own device. The current deal brings it down to just $90, which is pretty cheap for a tablet from a known brand. It‚Äôs also one of the lowest we have seen it drop to in a long while, but the offer ends soon. Grab yours before it‚Äôs too late.

data.title: Appeals court leaves Trump's New Jersey US attorney, Alina Habba, in limbo
data.description: In one of the latest setbacks for the Trump administration, New Jersey's acting U. S. attorney has been disqualified from the role after an appeal by the government. On Monday, an appellate court ruled that New Jersey acting U. S. Attorney Alina Habba, a Trump appointee, is disqualified from the role. 'It is apparent that the current administration has been frustrated by some of the legal and political barriers to getting its appointees in place.'A panel of three judges on the 3rd U. S. Circuit Court of Appeals two George W. Bush appointees and one Obama appointee unanimously affirmed a lower-court judge's ruling against Habba's appointment. ‚ÄúIt is apparent that the current administration has been frustrated by some of the legal and political barriers to getting its appointees in place. Its efforts to elevate its preferred candidate for U. S. Attorney for the District of New Jersey, Alina Habba, to the role of Acting U. S. Attorney demonstrate the difficulties it has faced yet the citizens of New Jersey and the loyal employees in the U. S. Attorney‚Äôs Office deserve some clarity and stability,‚Äù the court wrote, according to the Associated Press. Habba was sworn in as interim U. S. attorney for New Jersey on March 28 of this year, replacing John Giordano, now the ambassador to Namibia. The Trump administration has fought tirelessly to keep his appointed U. S. attorneys in their positions, including Bill Essayli in the Central District of California and Sigal Chattah in Nevada. Like Blaze News? data.title: Marcelo Figoli: el gestor del Parque de Atracciones es el pr√≥ximo rival del Real Zaragoza
data.description: El Real Zaragoza ya trabaja para medirse al Burgos en Copa, cuyo presidente es inversor y modernizador del recinto.
data.creator: Miguel Gay-Pobes Tena
data.content: El Real Zaragoza ya mira la Copa del Rey, con el Burgos como pr√≥ximo rival del torneo y en plena euforia por las tres victorias consecutivas. Aqu√≠ es donde entra en escena Marcelo Figoli, que es presidente de la entidad burgalesa y, a la vez, est√° inmiscuido en la modernizaci√≥n del Parque de Atracciones. Este jueves, su equipo debe jugar en el Ibercaja Estadio. Este lunes ya se ha comenzado a preparar el partido en la Ciudad Deportiva del Real Zaragoza. Todo con la vista a recibir al Burgos C. F. el d√≠a jueves 4 a las 21. 00 horas. Pues es aqu√≠ cuando deber√≠a visitar el estadio zaragozano el gestor del Parque de Atracciones. Por cierto, a su cargo est√° el proyecto de modernizaci√≥n del mismo. Adem√°s, el Real Zaragoza y el Burgos deben volver a verse las caras en 20 d√≠as, en El Plant√≠o, para disputar el partido de liga de la jornada 19. LA HISTORIA El presidente del Burgos, a trav√©s de Fenix Entertainment, entidad que tambi√©n preside, se uni√≥ a la familia Morte, principal gestora del Parque de Atracciones, el pasado mes de septiembre. Fue el inicio de una nueva etapa en el recinto, que cont√≥ con una inversi√≥n de 15 millones. Gracias a ella, est√° en marcha el proyecto con el que se prev√© dar un importante lavado de cara. Figoli, entre otras cuestiones, est√° metido en el mundo del f√∫tbol espa√±ol a trav√©s del Burgos, que ahora mismo se sit√∫a por encima del Real Zaragoza. Concretamente, en el puesto quinto, que si lo mantiene, le otorga el premio a disputar el playoff a Primera Divisi√≥n. Por contra, el Real Zaragoza se encuentra en la parte baja de la tabla, colista. Es decir, en el puesto 22 de Segunda Divisi√≥n. EL NUEVO PARQUE En marzo de 2026 est√° prevista la reapertura del Parque de Atracciones, teniendo de plazo hasta 2027 para la reforma completa.

data.title: The Crispiest Vegan Potato Latkes
data.description: The Crispiest Vegan Potato Latkes
data.creator: Robin Robertson
data.content: VegNews Recipes The Crispiest Vegan Potato Latkes These easy, crispy vegan potato latkes are perfect topped with applesauce or dairy-free sour cream. Nothing beats a freshly fried, crispy potato latke dolloped with vegan sour cream. And this recipe is so easy! What you need: 1¬Ω pounds russet potatoes 1 small yellow onion 1 tablespoon minced fresh parsley ¬º cup flour ¬Ω teaspoon baking powder 1 teaspoon salt ¬º teaspoon freshly ground black pepper Safflower oil, for frying What you do: Peel and grate potatoes, and then place in a colander and set over a large bowl. Using your hands, squeeze out excess liquid from potatoes. Pour off liquid and place potatoes in bowl. Grate onion and add to potatoes along with parsley, flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Preheat oven to 275 degrees. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat a thin layer of oil. Take a heaping tablespoon of batter and flatten before gently placing in hot oil. Make three or four more potato pancakes this way, and add to skillet without crowding pan. Fry until golden brown on both sides, turning once, about 8 minutes total. Repeat with remaining potato mixture, adding more oil as necessary. Remove cooked potato pancakes to paper towels to drain, then transfer to an ovenproof platter and keep warm in oven until all pancakes are cooked.

data.title: The Best Stephen King Movie of 2025 Loses Box Office Rank to ‚ÄòNow You See Me 3‚Äô
data.description: Now You See Me: Now You Don't has overtaken the best Stephen King movie of 2025 at the box office in only a few weeks.
data.creator: Adam Blevins
data.content: The new Now You See Me movie recently wrapped up its third full weekend in theaters, and despite the arrival of newer flicks, it has continued its run as a massive box office success story. At the time of writing, Now You See Me: Now You Don‚Äôt has grossed $42. 6 million at the domestic box office and $109. 4 million internationally for a worldwide total of $152 million. This $42 million in America is enough to push Now You See Me 3 past the total domestic haul of The Long Walk, the critically acclaimed Stephen King adaptation that released earlier this year. While Now You See Me: Now You Don‚Äôt hasn't been a critical darling by any means, audiences are enjoying the film enough to come out and see it before it leaves theaters. It currently sits at a lukewarm 61% from critics on the aggregate site Rotten Tomatoes, but an 81% on the audience-driven Popcornmeter. Directed by Ruben Fleischer and with a script from Rhett Reese, Paul Wernick, Michael Lesslie, Seth Grahame-Smith, and Eric Warren Singer, the film stars Jesse Eisenberg, Woody Harrelson, Dave Franco, and more. It‚Äôs expected to be in theaters for a few more weeks before it arrives on digital. As for The Long Walk, not only is it the best Stephen King movie of 2025, it‚Äôs one of the best movies of the year. With a Certified Fresh 88% from critics and an 85% from audiences, it‚Äôs been hailed as an adaptation that may even be better than the source material. There isn‚Äôt quite as much established power behind the film, though, as it found its leads in rising stars David Jonsson (Alien: Romulus) and Cooper Hoffman (Licorice Pizza). When Does 'Now You See Me 3' Begin Streaming? Lionsgate has yet to announce when Now You See Me: Now You Don‚Äôt will begin streaming, or even which platform it will air on upon its streaming debut. Lionsgate‚Äôs primary streaming outlet is Starz, where it will likely land when it does begin streaming, but it could also be coming to Netflix or HBO Max sometime after. The first two Now You See Me movies are only available on MovieSphere by Lionsgate. The most likely timeline for Now You See Me 3‚Äôs streaming debut is sometime early next year, as it will have a few weeks of VOD exclusivity before it begins streaming. Stay tuned to Collider for more box office updates and coverage of Now You See Me: Now You Don‚Äôt.

data.title: A California Law Voters Never Approved Lets Violent Criminals Walk Free ‚Äî And No One's Tracking Them
data.description: Over six years ago, California's Legislature quietly tucked a sweeping mental-health diversion law into a 900-page budget bill, bypassing voters entirely, and handed dangerous offenders what some legal officials are describing as a get-out-of-jail-free card. Sacramento County Sheriff Jim Cooper and San Diego County District Attorney Summer Stephan spoke with the Daily Caller News Foundation to discuss California's diversion model and how defendants charged with felony child abuse, carjackings, residential burglaries and attempted murders can walk free without ever entering a guilty plea. Both officials said inmates openly strategize around diversion, with Cooper mentioning the tactic being heard over recorded jail calls...

data.title: Microsoft CEO says empathy is a workplace superpower in the age of AI: 'IQ without EQ, it's just a waste'
data.description: Microsoft CEO says empathy is a workplace superpower in the age of AI: 'IQ without EQ, it's just a waste'
data.creator: Business Insider
data.content: As AI gets smarter, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella says that humans can't rely on their brains alone to succeed at work. In a recent conversation with Axel Springer CEO Mathias D√∂pfner, Nadella said he agrees that emotional intelligence, or EQ, is becoming increasingly important at work as AI handles more technical tasks. Axel Springer is Business Insider's parent company. "IQ has a place, but it's not the only thing that's needed in the world," Nadella said on an episode of D√∂pfner's "MD Meets" podcast that aired November 29. "I've always felt, at least leaders, if you just have IQ without EQ, it's just a waste of IQ." Nadella added that social intelligence is also key, and has previously said that empathy is an important business skill, not just a soft skill. D√∂pfner also asked whether the importance of empathy is part of why Microsoft is calling more people back to the office, starting early next year. Nadella said that, in the age of AI, it's even more important to recognize the role of human collaboration, and that the workplace is "the best collaboration tool." He added, however, that he doesn't want to be "dogmatic" about RTO mandates. Nadella has recently reshuffled Microsoft's leadership team in part to better compete in the AI race, according to documents reviewed by Business Insider. He also tapped Rolf Harms, who helped Microsoft on its journey to cloud-computing success, to serve as an advisor on AI economics, according to a memo Nadella sent in November. With its new superintelligence team, Microsoft is pursuing artificial general intelligence, or technology capable of outperforming humans on a range of complex tasks. Microsoft has laid off thousands of people this year, as the company has increased its scrutiny of employees' performance. A spokesperson previously told Business Insider that most of the cuts weren't based on performance, but instead aimed to streamline operations.

data.title: Fired worker sues government in case that could upend civil rights laws
data.description: A fired immigration judge says she was dismissed from her job because of her gender, her status as a dual citizen of Lebanon, and the fact that she once ran for municipal office in Ohio as a Democrat.
data.creator: Carrie Johnson
data.content: Tania Nemer is one of dozens of immigration judges fired by the Trump administration this year. But a new lawsuit filed in Washington, D. C., suggests what happened to Nemer-and why-has the potential to scramble the federal workforce and upend foundational civil rights laws. Nemer alleges that despite top performance reviews, she was dismissed from her job because of her gender, her status as a dual citizen of Lebanon, and the fact that she once ran for municipal office in Ohio as a Democrat. Those reasons, she says, are all in violation of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and the First Amendment. The government has responded by arguing the president's power to oversee the executive branch under Article II of the U. S. Constitution essentially overrides that core civil rights law, Nemer's attorney said. "This is a case in which the President of the United States has asserted a constitutional right to discriminate against federal employees," wrote her lawyer, Nathaniel Zelinsky, of the Washington Litigation Group. "If the government prevails in transforming the law, it will eviscerate the professional, non-partisan civil service as we know it." The administration abruptly fired Nemer in early February, summoning her from the bench and escorting her out of a federal building in Cleveland. Both her supervisor and the chief immigration judge there told her they didn't know why she was being dismissed in the middle of her probationary period, the lawsuit said. Federal workers on probationary status have fewer rights to contest their firing than other civil servants do, but they are still covered by constitutional protections barring retaliation for their political speech; and by civil rights laws that prohibit discrimination on the basis of race, sex, and national origin. Nemer filed a formal discrimination complaint with an Equal Employment Opportunity office a month after she was fired. That office dismissed her claims in September, asserting in its decision that Title VII of the Civil Rights Act conflicts with the president's power to remove federal workers within the executive branch. The implications sweep far beyond a single immigration judge, the new lawsuit said. "According to the final agency decision, the President may now fire female federal workers like Ms. Nemer-because of their sex-and the law would have nothing to say about it," according to the new lawsuit. "According to the final agency decision, the President can now fire federal workers born to immigrant parents with dual citizenship like Ms. Nemer-because of their national origin-and they would have no recourse. And under the same logic, the President can fire federal workers like Ms. Nemer-because of their political activities and affiliations-and the courts would be powerless to act." Nemer is seeking reinstatement, backpay and an order erasing her termination. She said she never got official notice about any reasons for her dismissal. But her lawsuit pointed out that in the administrative process, a senior Justice Department immigration official mentioned driving offenses from the late 1990s and early 2000s as well as two local tax cases Nemer had disclosed as part of a background check to become an immigration judge-issues her lawsuit casts as a "pretext.".

Streamingdienste wie Netflix setzen RTL im TV-Gesch√§ft zu. Nun drohen Entlassungen beim Medienkonzern. Die TV-Sendergruppe RTL plant einem Bericht zufolge einen gr√∂√üeren Stellenabbau in Deutschland. Das zum Medienkonzern Bertelsmann geh√∂rende Unternehmen wolle zwischen 800 und 1000 Besch√§ftigte abbauen, berichtete das Magazin "Wirtschaftswoche" am Montag. Die Pl√§ne betr√§fen die gesamte Sendergruppe, zu der neben dem Stammhaus RTL unter anderem auch der Sender Vox, der Nachrichtensender n-tv und der Streamingdienst RTL+ geh√∂ren. Die Sender leiden seit Jahren unter dem schwachen Werbemarkt und der Konkurrenz durch US-Streamingdienste wie Netflix. Mehrere Teilbetriebe von RTL w√ºrden eingestellt, dort komme es zu betriebsbedingten K√ºndigungen. "Dem Vernehmen nach" habe die Gesch√§ftsleitung mit dem Betriebsrat einen Sozialplan f√ºr den Stellenabbau ausgehandelt, so der Bericht. Die Belegschaft soll am Dienstag informiert werden. Von RTL war zun√§chst kein Kommentar zu erhalten. Der "Wirtschaftswoche" sagte eine Sprecherin: "Wir bitten um Verst√§ndnis, dass wir uns zu Spekulationen grunds√§tzlich nicht √§u√üern." Bertelsmann hatte sich zuletzt von seinen Print-Titeln getrennt und nur das Flaggschiff "stern" im Konzern behalten. Zugleich investierte der Konzern im TV-Gesch√§ft und k√ºndigte im Juni die √úbernahme von Sky Deutschland an. Erst im November wurde im Konzern die Nachfolge des langj√§hrigen Konzernchefs Thomas Rabe gekl√§rt. Ihm folgt ab 1. Januar 2027 Thomas Coesfeld. Der 35-J√§hrige ist damit der erste Chef aus dem Kreis der Bertelsmann-Familie seit 1981. Coesfeld ist der Enkel des 2009 verstorbenen Firmenpatriarchen Reinhard Mohn, der das G√ºtersloher Unternehmen von 1947 an √ºber mehr als drei Jahrzehnte steuerte.

data.title: El Gobierno de Arag√≥n contin√∫a apostando por la vivienda: rehabilitar√° 185 edificios en 94 pueblos
data.description: El Gobierno de Arag√≥n contin√∫a apostando por la vivienda: rehabilitar√° 185 edificios en 94 pueblos
data.creator: Redacci√≥n
data.content: El Gobierno de Arag√≥n contin√∫a buscando un impulso decidido a las pol√≠ticas de vivienda. Este lunes el Bolet√≠n Oficial de Arag√≥n (BOA) publica la resoluci√≥n provisional de subvenciones para rehabilitar 185 viviendas m√°s en 94 pueblos de Arag√≥n, correspondiente a la segunda convocatoria del Programa 700, dotada de 10 millones de euros. As√≠ lo ha anunciado hoy el consejero de Fomento, Vivienda, Log√≠stica y Cohesi√≥n Territorial, Octavio L√≥pez, durante la visita a una vivienda rehabilitada con el citado programa en la localidad turolense de Celadas. Tal como ha explicado el responsable de Vivienda del Gobierno auton√≥mico, se trata de ‚Äúayudas de entre 50. 000 y 66. 000 euros por vivienda rehabilitada a las que pueden optar los 700 municipios m√°s peque√±os de Arag√≥n y que sumar√°n un montante de 52, 5 millones de euros a lo largo de los seis a√±os de aplicaci√≥n del programa, gracias a los cuales se prev√© la promoci√≥n de unas 800 viviendas p√∫blicas a lo largo y ancho del territorio en el medio rural aragon√©s‚Äù. Siguiendo las bases de la convocatoria publicada el 19 de agosto de 2024, los municipios que ahora se ven beneficiados son los que pasaron a formar parte de una lista de reserva ordenada en base a la puntuaci√≥n obtenida entonces, seg√∫n la cual se estableci√≥ un orden de prelaci√≥n de cara a una siguiente tanda de ayudas, sin tener que cumplir m√°s requisitos que el de manifestar su voluntad de acceder a la subvenci√≥n, sin que haya sido preciso volver a presentar la documentaci√≥n exigida. 10 MILLONES EN AYUDAS ‚ÄúLa cuant√≠a de esta segunda fase de ayudas asciende a 10 millones de euros y los destinatarios de la misma son 94 municipios que se presentaron a la primera convocatoria en concurrencia competitiva, que cumpl√≠an los requisitos, entre ellos la capacidad de aportar suelo apto para la construcci√≥n de viviendas o edificaciones preexistentes que puedan ser rehabilitadas, y que se quedaron sin las ayudas por agotarse el cr√©dito presupuestario‚Äù, ha explicado Octavio L√≥pez. La cuant√≠a total de esta segunda convocatoria se va a distribuir de la siguiente manera: 6 millones en el presente ejercicio, un mill√≥n en 2026 y 3 millones en 2027. La presentaci√≥n de esta segunda convocatoria del Programa 700 se ha realizado en el municipio turolense de Celadas, de poco m√°s de 300 habitantes, perteneciente a la comarca de la Comunidad de Teruel, donde el Ayuntamiento ha recibido subvenci√≥n en esta segunda convocatoria del Programa 700 de 126. 000 euros para rehabilitar dos viviendas. El consejero Octavio L√≥pez, acompa√±ado de la alcaldesa, Raquel Clemente, ha visitado la primera de las obras que se est√° llevando a cabo para poner la primera de las dos viviendas al servicio de la ciudadan√≠a. ‚ÄúEsta es la manera que tiene el Gobierno de Jorge Azc√≥n de enfrentar el principal problema que hoy tienen los ciudadanos espa√±oles y aragoneses, construyendo y rehabilitando vivienda p√∫blica all√° donde se necesita, bien sea una gran capital, un municipio mediano, uno tur√≠stico o un peque√±o pueblo de la provincia de Teruel, como es Celadas, en el que hacer una o dos viviendas puede suponer un peque√±o pero decisivo paso para dar oportunidades a ese joven que se quiere quedar a vivir aqu√≠ o a es ese nuevo poblador que estar√≠a dispuesto a fijar su vida en este lugar y no pueden por la falta de vivienda‚Äù. L√≥pez ha destacado que a esta segunda convocatoria del Programa 700 se han presentado m√°s de 200 solicitudes, pr√°cticamente un tercio de los municipios, lo que, a juicio del consejero, demuestra ‚Äúun gran √©xito de un programa ideado por la Consejer√≠a que anteriormente no exist√≠a‚Äù. Por su parte, la regidora de Celadas, Raquel Clemente, ha agradecido al Gobierno de Arag√≥n "que sea capaz de tener esa sensibilidad hacia los pueblos y haber hecho este Programa 700 enfocado al medio rural, porque yo creo que es la primera vez que hemos tenido un programa con estas cuant√≠as para ayudarnos en el mayor problema que tenemos en el medio rural, que es la vivienda". En relaci√≥n a las viviendas que se est√°n rehabilitando, Clemente ha explicado que son pisos de dos habitaciones, un sal√≥n comedor y una cocina, pensados para que los j√≥venes puedan iniciar una nueva etapa en la vida con una cuota de alquiler asequible de 200 euros al mes. PROGRAMA 700: 355 VIVIENDAS EN 167 MUNICPIOS.

data.title: Burnley vs Crystal Palace Prediction and Betting Tips | December 3rd 2025
data.description: Burnley will host Crystal Palace at Turf Moor on Wednesday in another round of the 2025-26 Premier League campaign.
data.creator: Soyoye Jedidiah
data.content: Burnley will host Crystal Palace at Turf Moor on Wednesday in another round of the 2025-26 Premier League campaign. The home side endured a difficult November, losing all four of their matches in the month, and will be aiming for a stronger finish to the year as they sit 19th in the table with 10 points. They fell 3-1 to Brentford at the weekend and had looked on course to secure a point on hostile ground after Zian Flemming‚Äôs 85th-minute penalty brought them level, only for Brentford to score twice late on to reclaim the lead and cart away all three points. Thanks for the submission! Crystal Palace, meanwhile, hosted a floundering Manchester United side at Selhurst Park on Sunday with hopes of extending their strong league form and appeared well on course to do so after talisman Jean-Philippe Mateta put the Eagles ahead from the penalty spot in the first half. However, they faltered after the break, conceding twice in nine minutes to lose 2-1 and suffer their first home defeat to United since 2020. Sunday's defeat came just three days after Palace‚Äôs 2-1 loss to Strasbourg in Europe and they will be eager to halt the slump and quickly restart a positive run of results. Burnley vs Crystal Palace Head-to-Head and Key Numbers There have been 55 meetings between the two clubs. Burnley hold the upper hand in this fixture with 21 wins to Palace's 15, while their other 19 contests have ended level. The two teams last faced off in the 2023-24 Premier League campaign, with Palace winning both the home and away fixtures. Burnley have conceded 27 goals in the league this season. Only last-placed Wolverhampton Wanderers (28) have shipped more. Palace, meanwhile, have conceded 11 times in the Premier League this season. Only league leaders Arsenal (7) have conceded fewer. Burnley vs Crystal Palace Prediction The Clarets are on a four-game losing streak and have lost seven of their last nine. They are underdogs heading into this one but will look to make the most of their home advantage to perhaps secure a point. The Eagles have lost their last two games after going undefeated in their previous five. They have been inconsistent on the road recently but remain the stronger side ahead of Wednesday's game and should win this one. Prediction: Burnley 0-1 Crystal Palace Burnley vs Crystal Palace Betting Tips Tip 1 Result: Palace to win Tip 2 Goals Over/under 2. 5 Under 2. 5 goals (Four of the Eagles' last five league matches have produced fewer than 2. 5 goals) Tip 3 Both teams to score: No.

data.content: As the Baltimore Ravens and Carolina Panthers know, Week 13 is all but over in the NFL. As such, the countdown for the playoffs is on. Some teams will survive the cutoff, but some will not. Consequently, the playoffs will also begin much earlier for some teams than others. Here's a look at some of the most surprising teams that could miss the playoffs over the last month of the regular season. Thanks for the submission! How Baltimore Ravens, Carolina Panthers, and more can slip out of playoff race 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now #5 Los Angeles Chargers According to Sportskeeda's playoff predictor, the Los Angeles Chargers could finish in eighth place in the AFC with a 10-7 record and miss the playoffs. Losses against the Kansas City Chiefs, Houston Texans and Denver Broncos would be enough to end the team's season, despite beating the formidable Philadelphia Eagles. #4 Kansas City Chiefs The Kansas City Chiefs could finish in ninth place in the AFC and miss the playoffs with a 9-8 record. Winning against the Houston Texans, Los Angeles Chargers, and Las Vegas Raiders would not be enough to reach January. It would be enough to keep the team's streak of winning seasons alive, but not much more than that. #3 Dallas Cowboys The Dallas Cowboys have found a new gear in recent weeks, but the season could still end disappointingly at 8-8-1 and out of the playoff race. A Week 14 loss to the Detroit Lions and losses against the Los Angeles Chargers and Washington Commanders would be enough to keep the team out of the top seven. As such, they would be out of the playoff race. #2 Baltimore Ravens The Baltimore Ravens managed to salvage a division race out of a lifeless start to the year, but they can still finish under . 500 and miss the playoffs at 8-9. The Ravens could lose to the Pittsburgh Steelers twice and the Green Bay Packers to slip out of the running and finish as the tenth seed, three spots out of the running. #1 Carolina Panthers The Carolina Panthers are flying high after upsetting the Los Angeles Rams in Week 13, but the season could still end in anticlimactic fashion. Carolina can end up 9-8 and miss the playoffs as the ninth seed if they lose to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Seattle Seahawks in the final stretch of the season.

data.content: Fantasy football is heading into the final week of the regular season, which means for some teams, one player can make or break the last three-plus months. Of course, with many players having run out their welcome this season, you might be looking for some inspiration on who you can trust in what could be the biggest game yet of the year. Luckily, Sportskeeda has compiled this handy list of players to avoid and start. The lists take into account various factors, but aim to list only players with a high likelihood of spiking or flatlining this week. Without further ado, here's who should start and sit in Week 14 of fantasy football. Thanks for the submission! Fantasy Football Week 14 Start 'Em picks 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now Matthew Stafford had been on one of the longest runs without an interception in NFL history, but that ended against the Carolina Panthers. Expect Stafford to get back into form against the Arizona Cardinals, a team that hasn't managed to shut down much in recent weeks. Bucky Irving is back on the field after a long wait, and he didn't waste time producing. As such, managers should feel confident about leaning on the back heading into Week 14. James Cook faces the Cincinnati Bengals defense in Week 14, and that means significant fantasy points for managers after Cook ripped off two straight 100-yard performances, earning 144 yards against the Pittsburgh Steelers on Sunday. Must Starts James Cook Courtland Sutton Quinshon Judkins Jakobi Meyers Bucky Irving Khalil Shakir Josh Allen RJ Harvey Matthew Stafford Puka Nacua Jameson Williams Ja'Marr Chase Fantasy Football Week 14 Sit 'Em picks Lamar Jackson started the year in typical form, but it's clear that something isn't right. It could be a lingering injury, with the quarterback routinely appearing on the Baltimore Ravens' official injury report. Regardless, managers need to look elsewhere for the rest of the season. Marvin Harrison Jr. returned to the fold in Week 13, which means the Michael Wilson experiment is likely over. He might be worth keeping, but not worth starting except in desperate circumstances. Terry McLaurin is back and finally turned in a WR1-caliber fantasy football performance. However, the Washington Commanders will travel to face the Minnesota Vikings in their building, and after an exhausting overtime game on Sunday, don't expect a duplicate performance from the receiver who has been out of sorts for most of the year. data.title: Why rumors about Serena Williams making a tennis comeback are flying high again after shocking move?
data.description: Why rumors about Serena Williams making a tennis comeback are flying high again after shocking move?
data.creator: Aman Mohamed
data.content: Serena Williams is rumored to make a sensational return to professional tennis. Her name has appeared again on the International Tennis Integrity Agency (ITIA)‚Äôs International Registered Testing Pool (IRTP). Although the American is still listed as retired (2022), the ITIA rules state that players must be available for at least six months of testing before returning to tournaments. This could suggest that she may come back to the tour in 2026 or 2027. Thanks for the submission! Williams is one of the most decorated athletes in the history of women's tennis. She captured 23 Grand Slam titles and four Olympic Gold medals during her career. Williams being added to the IRTP isn‚Äôt the first sign she might return. The 44-year-old had openly shared her plans during a TechCrunch Disrupt event in San Francisco in 2022. ‚ÄúI am not retired. The chances of me returning are very high. You can come to my house and see that I have a court. I still haven‚Äôt really thought about it," Serena Williams said "I did go on the court the other day and [realised] for the first time in my life that I‚Äôm not playing for a competition and that felt very weird. It was like the first day of the rest of my life, and so far, I am enjoying it. But I‚Äôm still trying to find that balance,‚Äù She added Williams is often seen spending time with her family or focusing on her business ventures. She has also worked hard on her fitness, losing nearly 17 kg this year. "I challenge her to come back next year" Novak Djokovic misses Serena Williams' competitive spirit on tour Novak Djokovic is still competing at a high level on the ATP Tour. At 38, he reached the semifinals of all four Majors and also won the Hellenic Championships this year. The Serb enjoyed watching Serena Williams introduce her longtime rival Maria Sharapova at the International Tennis Hall of Fame. He described the moment as gracious and also lightheartedly invited Williams to make a comeback to the tour. ‚ÄúSeeing Serena, you know, in any shape or form around tennis is great. You know, we miss her. And she still hasn‚Äôt officially retired, so I invite her. I challenge her because she‚Äôs such a great competitor. So when somebody challenges her, she never refuses. So I challenge Serena. Come back on a Tour next year," Novak Djokovic said after winning the first round at the US Open Williams dominated the head-to-head battle against Sharapova 20-2. She defeated the Russian in straight sets during their last match at the 2022 US Open. Serena‚Äôs sister, Venus Williams, is still competing on the WTA Tour. She reached the quarterfinals of the US Open doubles tournament this year, partnering with Leylah Fernandez. Williams has yet to give an official update on her return to professional tennis. The American has been spotted at select events, watching some significant matches this year.
